de.esoco.lib.property

Interface StateProperties

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    UserInterfaceProperties

    public interface StateProperties
    Defines typical state Properties.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

    • Field Detail

      • CARET_POSITION

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.Integer> CARET_POSITION
        Integer: the (initial) position of the text input caret.

      • DISABLED

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.Boolean> DISABLED
        Boolean: TRUE to explicitly disable an element.

      • HIDDEN

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.Boolean> HIDDEN
        Boolean: TRUE to hide an element from rendering completely. To only make it invisible use INVISIBLE.

      • INVISIBLE

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.Boolean> INVISIBLE
        Boolean: TRUE to make an element invisible but keep it in the layout. To hide it completely use HIDDEN.

      • NO_INTERACTION_LOCK

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.Boolean> NO_INTERACTION_LOCK
        Boolean: TRUE to prevent the locking of an element during interactions with a server.

      • NO_EVENT_PROPAGATION

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.Boolean> NO_EVENT_PROPAGATION
        Boolean: TRUE to prevent the propagation of component events to it's parent hierarchy.

      • ACTION_EVENT_ON_ACTIVATION_ONLY

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.Boolean> ACTION_EVENT_ON_ACTIVATION_ONLY
        Boolean: fire action events only if a component that implements ActiveState has been activated, but not if deactivated.

      • FOCUSED

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.Boolean> FOCUSED
        Boolean: TRUE to mark the element that should receive the input focus. This flag should only occur once in an user interface definition. The behavior for occurrences on multiple elements depends on the underlying platform.

      • CURRENT_SELECTION

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.Integer> CURRENT_SELECTION
        Integer: the current selection index of a multiple-data element.

      • FILTER_CRITERIA

        static final PropertyName<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> FILTER_CRITERIA
        String map: filter criteria of an element (e.g. a table). The key denotes the filtered attribute and the value the criterion.

      • SORT_DIRECTION

        static final PropertyName<SortDirection> SORT_DIRECTION
        Enum: if present, defines the sort direction for ordered data.

      • VALUE_CHANGED

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.Boolean> VALUE_CHANGED
        Boolean: indicates that the value of an element has changed.

      • PROPERTIES_CHANGED

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.Boolean> PROPERTIES_CHANGED
        Boolean: indicates that one or more properties of an element have changed.

      • STRUCTURE_CHANGED

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.Boolean> STRUCTURE_CHANGED
        Boolean: indicates that the structure of an element has changed.

      • INTERACTIVE_INPUT_MODE

        static final PropertyName<InteractiveInputMode> INTERACTIVE_INPUT_MODE
        Enum: the input mode for interactive input elements.

      • DISABLE_ON_INTERACTION

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.Boolean> DISABLE_ON_INTERACTION
        Boolean: whether an element should be explicitly disabled if it causes an interaction.

      • EVENT_HANDLING_DELAY

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.Integer> EVENT_HANDLING_DELAY
        Integer: a delay in milliseconds to postpone the event handling for an element with.

      • INTERACTION_EVENT_TYPES

        static final PropertyName<java.util.Set<InteractionEventType>> INTERACTION_EVENT_TYPES
        Set of enums: the event types to be listened to in interactive user interfaces.

      • INTERACTION_EVENT_DATA

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.String> INTERACTION_EVENT_DATA
        String: an optional data value for interaction events. If this value is available in an event it's string representation will be transferred to the server in this property.

      • TARGET_ID

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.String> TARGET_ID
        String: the identifier of a target element to be activated or modified by the element it is set upon.

      • SELECTION_DEPENDENCY

        static final PropertyName<java.lang.String> SELECTION_DEPENDENCY
        String: a comma-separated list of the names of user interface elements that have a (mutual) dependency on the selection of the target element. The exact meaning of this depends on the implementation of the user interface elements but possible variants would be:
        • Lists and similar selectable elements: their selection is mutually exclusive. If a selection occurs in one element, the others are unselected and vice versa.
        • Other elements: if the target element is selected the enabled state of the dependent components is modified. Buttons and lists will toggle the state while checkboxes and radio buttons directly represent the selection state of the elements. If the element list starts with the string SELECTION_DEPENDENCY_REVERSE_PREFIX the dependent elements will be enabled if the toggle button is not selected.

      • SELECTION_DEPENDENCY_REVERSE_PREFIX

        static final java.lang.String SELECTION_DEPENDENCY_REVERSE_PREFIX
        A prefix to be added to reverse the effect of the user interface property SELECTION_DEPENDENCY for toggle buttons.
        See Also:
